result.execSummary:
The defendant Thurston T Faulkner Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Submit to a Mental Health or Addiction Assessment.

Maintain Absolute sobriety.
Not to use/possess drugs/alcohol/or medications unless prescribed by a Doctor.
No drug paraphernalia.
Submit to random urine screens.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thurston T Faulkner in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 1, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months)  Stayed for 3 years Probation - consecutive to present sentence. 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail - consec. 
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - not possess drugs/alcohol or medications unless authorized by medical personnel. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Mental health or addiction assessment. No drug paraphernalia. All prescriptions are to be prescribed by a doctor. Random UA's.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
- 10 months jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.
from Dodge Correctional Institute for October 30, 2014  at 8:30 for Jury Status and November 4, 2014 for Jury Trial

Jury status hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 18, 2014 at 09:30 am.
